lines.gurmukhi: 1 siqgur dI mihNmw, gurU snmuK qy vymuK dw AMq
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur purKu AgMmu hY inrvYru inrwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Purakhu Aganmu Hai Niravairu Niraalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is inaccessible, without rancour and extraordinary.

lines.gurmukhi: jwxhu DrqI Drm kI scI Drmswlw
lines.transliteration_english: Jaanahu Dharatee Dharam Kee Sachee Dharamasaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Consider earth as the true abode of dharma.

lines.gurmukhi: jyhw bIjY so luxY Pl krm smHwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Jayhaa Beejai So Lounai Phalu Karam Samhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Here karmas take care of the fruits i.e. one reaps what he sows.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau kir inrmlu AwrsI jgu vyKix vwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Kari Niramalu Aarasee Jagu Vaykhani Vaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He (the Lord) is the mirror in which the world can see its face reflected.

lines.gurmukhi: jyhw muhu kir BwlIAY qyho vyKwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Jayhaa Muhu Kari Bhaaleeai Tayho Vaykhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One would see the same face he will carry before the mirror.

lines.gurmukhi: syvk drgh surKrU vymuK muhu kwlw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Sayvaku Daragah Surakharoo Vaymoukhu Muhu Kaalaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The servants of God remain red faced and triumphant whereas the apostates keep their faces blackened.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 gur gopU cylw

Shabad OS B.translation: The disciple hiding the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: jo gur gopY Awpxw ikau isJY cylw
lines.transliteration_english: Jo Gur Gopai Aapanaa Kiu Sijhai Chaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the disciple does not know (tell) about his guru, how could he get liberated.

lines.gurmukhi: sMglu Giq clweIAY jm pMiQ iekylw
lines.transliteration_english: Sangalu Ghati Chalaaeeai Jam Panthi Ikaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bound in chains, he is forced to walk alone on the way of the Yama, death.

lines.gurmukhi: lhY sjweI nrk ivic auhu Krw duhylw
lines.transliteration_english: Lahai Sajaaeen Narak Vichi Uhu Kharaa Duhaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In dilemma he stands and suffers hell.

lines.gurmukhi: lK caurwsIh BauidAwN iPir hoie n mylw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Chauraaseeh Bhaudiaan Dhiri Hoi N Maylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though he transmigrates in the eighty four lac species of life yet he does not meet the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: jnmu pdwrQu hwirAw ijau jUey Kylw
lines.transliteration_english: Janamu Padaaradu Haariaa Jiu Jooay Khaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like the playing of gamble, he loses the invaluable stake of life in this game.

lines.gurmukhi: hQ mroVY isru DunY auhu lhY n vylw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Had Marorhai Siru Dhounai Uhu Lahai N Vaylaa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: At the end (of life) he has jitters and lamentations but the time gone never returns.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 gur gopU bymuK hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru prevaricator is apostate

lines.gurmukhi: Awip n vM\\\\Y swhury isK lok suxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapi N Vanai Saahuray Sikh Lok Sounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru prevaricator is similar to a girl who herself goes not to the father-in law's house and gives precepts to others.

lines.gurmukhi: kMqu n puCY vwqVI suhwgu gxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kant N Pouchhai Vaatarhee Suhaagu Ganaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Her husband never cares for her and she sings paeans of her happy married life.

lines.gurmukhi: cUhw Kf n mwveI lik Cju vlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Choohaa Khad N Maavaee Laki Chhaju Valaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is such as the rat itself cannot enter the hole but roams tied winnowing tray to its waist.

lines.gurmukhi: mMqu n hoie ATUihAw hQu spIN pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Mantu N Hoi Atdoohiaan Hadu Sapeen Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is such a person as not knowing even the mantra of a centipede lays his hand on a snake.

lines.gurmukhi: sru sMnHY Awgws no iPir mQY AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Saru Sannhai Aagaas No Dhiri Madai Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The person who facing towards sky shoots the arrow receives the arrow on his own face.

lines.gurmukhi: duhI srweIN jrdrU bymuK pCuqwvY ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Duhee Saraaeen Jarad Roo Baymoukh Pachhoutaavai ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate is yellow faced, frightened in both the worlds and repents.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 bymuK rs nhIN lYNdw

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate cannot enjoy

lines.gurmukhi: rqn mxI gil bwNdrY ikhu kIm n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Ratan Manee Gali Baandarai Kihu Keem N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The monkey knows no worth of the jewellary tied to its neck.

lines.gurmukhi: kVCI swau n sMmHlY Bojn rsu KwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Karhachhee Saau N Sanmhalai Bhojan Rasu Khaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even being in the food, the ladle does not know the taste of the dishes.

lines.gurmukhi: ffU ickiV vwsu hY kvlY n is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Dadoo Chikarhi Vaasu Hai Kavalay N Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The frog always lives in mire but still knows not the lotus.

lines.gurmukhi: nwiB kQUrI imrg dY iPrdw hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Naabhi Kadooree Mirag Dai Dhiradaa Hairaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having musk in its navel the deer runs around confused.

lines.gurmukhi: gujru gorsu vyic kY Kil sUVI AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gujaru Gorasu Vaychi Kai Khali Soorhee Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cattle breeder puts the milk on sale but fetches home, the oil cakes and husk.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK mUlhu GuiQAw duK shY jmwxY ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Moolahu Ghudiaa Doukh Sahai Jamaanai ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate is a person basically gone astray and he undergoes the sufferings given by the Yama.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 bymuK huMidAwN suMidAwN duKI

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate posseses everything but still is unhappy

lines.gurmukhi: swvix vix hrIAwvly sukY jwvwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Saavani Vani Hareeaavalay Soukai Jaavaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the month of savan, the whole forest becomes green but javels, a prickly plant remains dry.

lines.gurmukhi: sB ko srsw vrsdy JUry jolwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Ko Sarasaa Varasadai Jhooray Jolaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: During rains every one feels delighted but the weaver is seen gloomy.

lines.gurmukhi: sBnw rwiq imlwvVw ckvI dorwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhanaa Raati Milaavarhaa Chakavee Doraahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the night all the pairs meet but for chakavi , that is the time of separation.

lines.gurmukhi: sMKu smuMdhu sKxw rovY dy Dwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Sankhu Samoundahu Sakhanaa Rovai Day Dhaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The conch remains empty even in the ocean and cries when blown.

lines.gurmukhi: rwhhu auJiV jo pvY musY dy Pwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Raahahu Ujharhi Jo Pavai Mousai Day Dhaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The man gone astray will definitely be robbed by putting rope around his neck.

lines.gurmukhi: iqau jg AMdir bymuKwN inq auBy swhw ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Tioun Jag Andari Baymoukhaan Nit Oubhay Saahaa ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the apostates go on sobbing in this world.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 bymuK ig`dV dwK hY, Awpxw doS dUey nUM

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate puts blame on others   ,

lines.gurmukhi: igdV dwK nw ApVY AwKY QUh kauVI
lines.transliteration_english: Gidarh Daakh N Aparhai Aakhai Dooh Kaurhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The jackal cannot reach the grapes and says disdainfully that grapes are sour.

lines.gurmukhi: ncxu nic nw jwxeI AwKY Buie sauVI
lines.transliteration_english: Nachanu Nachi N Jaanaee Aakhai Bhui Saurhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The dancer knows no dance but says that the place is narrow.

lines.gurmukhi: bolY AgY gwvIAY BYrau so gauVI
lines.transliteration_english: Bolai Agai Gaaveeai Bhairau So Gaurhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Before a deaf person singing in measure Bhairav or Gaul is the same.

lines.gurmukhi: hMswN nwil ttIhrI ikau phucY dauVI
lines.transliteration_english: Hansaan Naali Tateeharee Kiu Pahouchai Daurhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: How a plover can fly equal to a swan.

lines.gurmukhi: swvix vx hrIAwvly Aku jMmY AauVI
lines.transliteration_english: Saavani Van Hareeaavalay Aku Janmai Aurhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The whole of the forest goes green in rainy season (sit-van) but akk, the wild plant of sandy region (calotropis procera) grows in the period of drought.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK suKu nw dyKeI ijau CutiV CauVI ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Soukhu N Daykhaee Jiu Chhoutarhi Chhaurhee ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate cannot have happiness like an abandoned woman.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 bymuK dI sMgq dw Pl

Shabad OS B.translation: The result of company of an apostate

lines.gurmukhi: ByfY pUCil ligAwN ikau pwir lMGIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaydai Poochhali Lagiaan Kiu Paari Lagheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: How one could get across the water by catching hold of the tail of a sheep.

lines.gurmukhi: BUqY kyrI dosqI inq shsw jIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhootai Kayree Dosatee Nit Sahasaa Jeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Friendship with a ghost is always a source of suspicious life.

lines.gurmukhi: ndI iknwrY ruKVw vyswhu nw kIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Nadee Kinaarai Roukharhaa Vaysaahu N Keeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tree on a river bank cannot have the faith (that the river will not perish it).

lines.gurmukhi: imrqk nwil vIAwhIAY sohwgu n QIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Miratak Naali Veeaaheeai Sohaagu N Deeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: How a woman married to a dead person could be said to be a suhagin, i.e one whose husband is alive.

lines.gurmukhi: ivsu hlwhl bIij kY ikau Aimau lhIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Visu Halaahal Beeji Kai Kiu Amiu Laheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: How nectar could be obtained by sowing poison.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK syqI iprhVI jm fMfu shIAY ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Saytee Piraharhee Jam Dandu Saheeai ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: The friendship with an apostate brings the sufferings of the rod of Yama.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 bymuK Awp doSI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate himself is a culprit

lines.gurmukhi: korVu moTu n irJeI kir AgnI josu
lines.transliteration_english: Korarhu Motdu N Rijhaee Kari Aganee Josu.

Shabad OS B.translation: When moth, an Indian pulse is cooked over the fire some grains being hard remain uncooked.

lines.gurmukhi: shs Plhu ieku ivgVY qrvr kI dosu
lines.transliteration_english: Sahas Phalahu Iku Vigarhai Taravar Kee Dosu.

Shabad OS B.translation: This is not the fault of the fire. If one fruit out of a thousand go bad, it is not the fault of the tree.

lines.gurmukhi: itbY nIru nw TwhrY Gix vris gieEsu
lines.transliteration_english: Tibai Neeru N Tdaaharai Ghani Varasi Gaiaosu.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is not the fault of water that it will not rest on a hill.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu sMjim rogI mrY iciq vYd n rosu
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Sanjami Rogee Marai Chiti Vaid N Rosu.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a sick person die from not observing the regimen prescribed for him, it is not the fault of the doctor.

lines.gurmukhi: AivAwvr n ivAwpeI msqik iliKEsu
lines.transliteration_english: Aviaavar N Viaapaee Masataki Likhiaosu.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a barren woman have no offspring, it is her destiny and not the fault of her husband.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK pVHY n ielm ijau Avgux siB Esu ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Parhhai N Ilam Jioun Avagoun Sabhiaosu ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the same way if a perverse man accept not the Guru's instruction, it is his own fault and not the Guru's.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 bymuK dI kmweI doSI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The earning of an apostate is defective

lines.gurmukhi: AMnHY cMdu n idseI jig joiq sbweI
lines.transliteration_english: Annhai Chandu N Disaee Jagi Joti Sabaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The blind cannot see the moon though its light scatters all around.

lines.gurmukhi: bolw rwgu n smJeI ikhu Git n jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bolaa Raagu N Samajhaee Kihu Ghati N Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The music loses not its melody if a deaf cannot understand it.

lines.gurmukhi: vwsu n AwvY guxguxY prmlu mihkweI
lines.transliteration_english: Vaasu N Aavai Gounagounai Paramalu Mahikaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In spite of plenty of fragrance, the person without power of smell cannot enjoy the same.

lines.gurmukhi: guMgY jIB nw auGVY siB sbid suhweI
lines.transliteration_english: Goungai Jeev N Ougharhai Sabhi Sabadi Suhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The word resides in one and all, but the dumb cannot move his tongue (to pronounce it).

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru swgru syiv kY iniD sBnw pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Saagaru Sayvi Kai Nidhi Sabhanaan Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is an ocean and the true servants receive treasures out of it.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK hiQ GGUitAw iqsu dosu kmweI ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Hadi Ghaghootiaan Tisu Dosu Kamaaee ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostates get ',the shells only because their cultivation and labour is defective.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 bymuK dy msqk dw rUp

Shabad OS B.translation: Nature of the apostate

lines.gurmukhi: rqn aupMny swierhu BI pwxI Kwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Ratan Oupannay Saairahu Bhee Paanee Khaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Jewels have come out of sea but still its water is brackish.

lines.gurmukhi: suJhu suJin iqin loA AaulMgu ivickwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Sujhahu Sujhani Tini Loa Aulagu Vichikaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the light of moon, the three worlds are seen, yet the stigma on moon persists.

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI aupjY AMnu Dnu ivic klru Bwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Oupajai Annu Dhanu Vichi Kalaru Bhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The earth produces the corn but still alkaline earth is also there.

lines.gurmukhi: eIsru qusY hornw Gir Kpru Cwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Eesaru Tousai Horanaa Ghari Khaparu Chhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Siva, getting happy, grants boons to others but in his own home only ashes and begging bowl are found.

lines.gurmukhi: ijauN hxvMiq kCotVw ikAw krY ivcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jioun Hanavanti Kachhotarhaa Kiaa Karai Vichaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The powerful Hanuman can do a lot for others but has only a loincloth to wear.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK msqik iliKAw kauxu mytxhwrw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Masataki Likhiaa Kaounu Maytanahaaraa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Who can efface the words of destiny of the apostate.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 bymuK JUTw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate is a tier

lines.gurmukhi: gwNeI Gir goswNeIAwN mwDwxu GVwey
lines.transliteration_english: Gaanee Ghari Gosaaneeaan Maadhaanu Gharhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cow herds are there in the house of the master, the foolish person continues getting the churning sticks made for his own home.

lines.gurmukhi: GoVy suix saudwgrwN cwbk muil Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Ghorhay Souni Saudaagaraan Chaabak Muli Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The horses are with the merchants and the foolish person roams around purchasing the whips.

lines.gurmukhi: dyiK prwey BwjvwV Gir gwhu Gqwey
lines.transliteration_english: Daykhi Paraaay Bhaajavaarh Ghari Gaahu Ghataaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Foolish person creates stampede at his home only by seeing the harvest of others around the threshing floor.

lines.gurmukhi: suienw hit srwP dy suinAwr sdwey
lines.transliteration_english: Suinaa Hati Saraadh Day Souniaar Sadaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gold is with the gold merchant but the foolish calls for the goldsmith at his own home for preparing the jewellery.

lines.gurmukhi: AMdir FoeI nw lhY bwhir bwPwey
lines.transliteration_english: Andari Ddhoee Naa Lahai Baahari Baadhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He has no place at home, but goes on boasting outside.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK bdl Cwv hY kUVo Awlwey ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Badal Chaal Hai Koorho Aalaaay ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate is unstable like the speedy cloud and goes on telling lies.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 bymuK- KwlI ho igAw

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate is empty-

lines.gurmukhi: mKxu lieAw ivroilkY Cwih CutiV hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Makhanu Laiaa Viroli Kai Chhaahi Chhoutarhi Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the butter is churned and taken away, the butter milk (lassi) is abandoned.

lines.gurmukhi: pIV leI rsu gMinAhuN iClu CuhY n koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Peerh Laee Rasu Ganniahu Chhilu Chhuhai N Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the juice of sugarcane is extracted out, nobody touches the bagasse.

lines.gurmukhi: rMgu mjIThu inklY AFu lhY n soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Rangu Majeetdahu Nikalai Addhu Lahai N Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the fast colour of Rubia munjista is taken away then nobody cares for it even worth a penny.

lines.gurmukhi: vwsu leI PulvwVIAhu iPir imlY n FoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Vaasu Laee Phulavaarheeahu Dhiri Milai N Ddhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the fragrance of flowers is exhausted, no more shelter they get.

lines.gurmukhi: kwieAw hMsu ivCuMinAw iqsu ko n sQoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Kaaiaa Hansu Vichhounniaa Tisu Ko N Sadoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the atman separates from the body, no companion of the body remains.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK suky ruK ijauN vyKY sB loeI ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Soukay Roukh Jioun Vaykhai Sabh Loee ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: It is clear to everyone that the apostate is like drywood (which can only be pushed into fire).

lines.gurmukhi: 13 bymuK ik`kUM swDIdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: How the apostate could be set right

lines.gurmukhi: ijau kir KUhhu inklY gil bDy pwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Kari Khoohahu Nikalai Gali Badhay Paanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The water is drawn out of well only when the pitcher is tied from the neck (with rope).

lines.gurmukhi: ijau mix kwly sp isir his dyie n jwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Mani Kaalay Sap Siri Hasi Dayi N Jaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cobra does not happily give away the jewel in the head (it gives only after getting killed).

lines.gurmukhi: jwx kQUrI imrg qin mir mukY AwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaan Kadooree Mirag Tani Mari Moukai Aanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The deer also gives musk only after its death.

lines.gurmukhi: qyl iqlhu ikau inklY ivxu pIVy GwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Tayl Tilahu Kiu Nikalai Vinu Peerhay Ghaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The deer also gives musk only after its death.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau muhu BMny grI dy nlIeyru inswxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Muhu Bhannay Garee Day Naleeayru Nisaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The kernel of coconut can be got only when its mouth is broken.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK lohw swDIAY vgdI vwdwxI ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Lohaa Saadheeai Vagadee Vaadaanee ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate is such an iron that can be given desired shape only with the strokes of hammer.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 bymuK dw sB kuC pu`Tw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate is always inverted)

lines.gurmukhi: mhurw imTw AwKIAY ruTI no quTI
lines.transliteration_english: Mahuraa Mitdaa Aakheeai Routdee No Toutdee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The foolish would say the poison sweet and the angry person a happy one.

lines.gurmukhi: buiJAw vfw vKwxIAY swvwrI kuTI
lines.transliteration_english: Bujhiaa Vadaa Vakhaaneeai Savaaree Koutdee.

Shabad OS B.translation: To the extinguished lamp he says the enlarged one and a killed goat to him is dressed one.

lines.gurmukhi: jilAw TMFw geI no AweI qy auTI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaliaa Tdaddhaa Gaee No Aaee Tay Outdee.

Shabad OS B.translation: To burnt he would say the cooled one: the 'gone' for him is 'come' and the 'come' one for him is eloped one i.e. if something sets in the eye, the eye is said to be soaring and if a widow settles in someone's house by marrying him, she is said to have elo

lines.gurmukhi: Ahmku Bolw AwKIAY sB gil ApuTI
lines.transliteration_english: Ahamaku Bholaa Aakheeai Sabh Gali Apoutdee.

Shabad OS B.translation: To moron he would say simple, and his all talks will be contrary to normal.

lines.gurmukhi: aujVu qRtI bymuKwN iqsu AwKin vuTI
lines.transliteration_english: Ujarhu Tratee Baymoukhaan Tisu Aakhani Voutdee.

Shabad OS B.translation: To the ruining person, the foolish would say that he is leaving everything of his own sweet will.

lines.gurmukhi: corY sMdI mwau ijauN luik rovY guTI ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Chorai Sandee Maaoun Jioun Louki Rovai Moutdee ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such people are like the mother of a thief who weeps hiding in a corner (lest she is detected and possibility of catching hold of her son increases).

lines.gurmukhi: 15 bymuK dI sMgq dw Pl

Shabad OS B.translation: Result of the association of apostates

lines.gurmukhi: vVIAY kjl koTVI muhu kwlK BrIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Varheeai Kajal Kotdarhee Muhu Kaalakh Bhareeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If someone enters a room full of soot his face is sure to be blackened.

lines.gurmukhi: klir KyqI bIjIAY ikhu kwju nw srIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Kalari Khaytee Beejeeai Kihu Kaaju N Sareeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If seed be sown in the alkaline field, that will go useless.

lines.gurmukhi: tutI pINGY pINGIAY pY toey mrIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Toutee Peenghai Peengheeai Pai Toay Mareeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If somebody swings in a broken swing, he will fall and kill himself.

lines.gurmukhi: kMnw PiV mnqwrUAwN ikau duqru qrIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Kannaan Dharhi Manataarooaan Kiu Doutaru Tareeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a man who does not know how to swim, leans on the shoulders of another equally ignorant, how shall he cross a deep river?

lines.gurmukhi: Aig lwie mMdir svY iqsu nwil n PrIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Agi Laai Mandari Savai Tisu Naali N Dhareeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Move not with him who sets fire to his own house and then goes to sleep.

lines.gurmukhi: iqauN Tg sMgiq bymuKwN jIA joKhu frIAY ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Tioun Tdag Sangati Baymoukhaan Jeea Jokhahu Dareeai ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such is the society of the deceitful and apostates wherein man is ever in fear of his life.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 bymuK Gor pwpI hn

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate is a big sinner

lines.gurmukhi: bwmHx gwNeI vMs Gwq AprwD krwry
lines.transliteration_english: Baamhan Gaanee Vans Ghaat Aparaadh Karaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: (It is said that) The killing of brahmin, cow and the man of one's own family is a deadly sin.

lines.gurmukhi: mdu pI jUey Kyldy johin prnwry
lines.transliteration_english: Madu Pee Jooay Khayladay Johani Par Naaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The drunkards gamble and look at the wives of others.

lines.gurmukhi: muhin prweI lCmI Tg cor cgwry
lines.transliteration_english: Muhani Paraaee Lakhimee Tdag Chor Chagaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The thieves and decoits loot other's wealth.

lines.gurmukhi: ivsws DRohI AikrqGix pwpI hiqAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Visaas Dhrohee Akirataghan Paapee Hatiaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: These all are treacherous, ungrateful, sinners and killers.

lines.gurmukhi: lK kroVI joVIAin Axgxq Apwry
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Karorhee Jorheeani Anaganat Apaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: If such persons are gathered in infinite number;

lines.gurmukhi: iekqu lUie n pujnI bymuK gurduAwry ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikatu Looi N Pujanee Baymoukh Guraduaaray ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Even they all are not equal to the single hair of the apostate.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 bymuKqweI dI h`qRXw lihNdI nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: The sin of apostasy does not get off

lines.gurmukhi: gMg jmun godwvrI kulKyq isDwry
lines.transliteration_english: Gang Jamoun Godaavaree Kulakhayt Sidhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: If one goes to the Ganges, Yamuna, Godavari and Kurukshetr.

lines.gurmukhi: mQurw mwieAw AjuiDAw kwNsI kydwry
lines.transliteration_english: Maduraa Maaiaa Ayudhiaa Kaasee Kaydaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mathure, Mayapuri, Ayodhya , Kasi, Kedarnath are also visited.

lines.gurmukhi: gieAw iprwg srsuqI gomqI duAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Gaiaa Piraag Sarasoutee Gomatee Duaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The door of Gomati, Sarasvati, Prayag. Gaya is too approached.

lines.gurmukhi: jpu qpu sMjmu hom jig sB dyv juhwry
lines.transliteration_english: Japu Tapu Sanjamu Hom Jagi Sabh Dayv Juhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: All sort of rectations, penances, continences, yajns, homs are practised and all the gods are eulogised.

lines.gurmukhi: AKI prxY jy BvY iqhu loA mJwry
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Paranai Jay Bhavai Tihu Loa Majhaarai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The eyes putting on earth if even the three worlds are visited.

lines.gurmukhi: mUil n auqrY hiqAw bymuK gurduAwry ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Mooli N Outarai Hatiaa Baymoukh Guraduaaray ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: Even then the sin of apostasy never fades out.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 siqgur bwJ suK nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: No happiness without true Guru

lines.gurmukhi: kotIN swdIN kyqVy jMgl BUpwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Koteen Saadeen Kaytarhay Jangal Bhoopaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are engrossed in myriad of tastes, and many are the kings of the forests.

lines.gurmukhi: QlIN vroly kyqVy prbq byqwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Daleen Varolay Kaytarhay Parabat Baytaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are the places, whirlwinds, mountains and the ghosts.

lines.gurmukhi: ndIAwN nwly kyqVy srvr Asrwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Nadeeaan Naalay Kaytarhay Saravar Asaraalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are the rivers, streams and the deep tanks.

lines.gurmukhi: AMbir qwry kyqVy ibsIAru pwqwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Anbari Taaray Kaytarhay Biseearu Paataalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sky has many a star and in the nether world innumerable are the serpents.

lines.gurmukhi: BMBlBUsy BuilAwN Bvjl Brnwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhanbhal Bhoosay Bhuliaan Bhavajal Bharanaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are wandering confused in the labyrinth of world.

lines.gurmukhi: ieksu siqgur bwhry siB Awl jMjwlw ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikasu Satigur Baaharay Sabhi Aal Janjaalaa ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without one true Guru all else are perplexities.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 bymuK kyNdR hIn hn

Shabad OS B.translation: The apostate is centreless

lines.gurmukhi: bhuqI GrIN prwhuxw ijau rhdw BuKw
lines.transliteration_english: Bahouteen Ghareen Paraahounaa Jiu Rahandaa Bhoukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A guest of many houses remains hungry.

lines.gurmukhi: swNJw bbu n roeIAY iciq icMq n cuKw
lines.transliteration_english: Saanjh Babu N Roeeai Chiti Chint N Choukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On the loss of common father of many, scant are the weeping and mental anxieties.

lines.gurmukhi: bhlI fUmI FF ijau Ehu iksY n DuKw
lines.transliteration_english: Bahalee Doomee Ddhaddhi Jiu Aohu Kisai N Dhoukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When many drummers strike a drum, no one is pleased with the discordant voices.

lines.gurmukhi: vix vix kwauN n soheI ikau mwxY suKw
lines.transliteration_english: Vani Vani Kaaoun N Sohaee Kioun Maanai Soukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: How could a crow wandering from forest to forest be happy and honourable.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau bhu imqI vysuAw qin vydin duKw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Bahu Mitee Vaysuaa Tani Vaydani Doukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As a prostitute's body suffers from having many lovers,

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu gur pUjin hornw brny bymuKw ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Poojani Horanaa Baranay Baymoukhaa ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who worship others than the Guru are unhappy in their apostasy.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 AxhoNdw grbI BUq hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The egotist is a ghost

lines.gurmukhi: vwie suxwey CwnxI iqsu auT auTwly
lines.transliteration_english: Vaai Sounaaay Chhaananee Tisu Outd Outdaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the sound of the seive it is vain to cause the camel to get up.

lines.gurmukhi: qwVI mwir frwieMdw mYNgl mqvwly
lines.transliteration_english: Taarhee Maari Daraaindaa Maingal Matavaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Frightening the elephant with the clappings of the hands is as futile

lines.gurmukhi: bwsik nwgY swmHxw ijauN dIvw bwly
lines.transliteration_english: Baasaki Naagai Saamhanaa Jioun Deevaa Baalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: As burning of the lamp before a Väsuki cobra (in the hope that it will run away).

lines.gurmukhi: sIhuM srjY shw ijauN AKI vyKwly
lines.transliteration_english: Seehoun Sarajai Sahaa Jioun Akheen Vaykhaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: If rabbit looking into the eyes wishes to frighten the lion (it is nothing but a deathwish).

lines.gurmukhi: swier lhir n pujnI pwxI prnwly
lines.transliteration_english: Saair Lahari N Pujanee Paanee Paranaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Small water conduit pipes can not be equal to the ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: Axhodw Awpu gxwiedy mymuK byqwly ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Anahondaa Aapu Ganaainday Baymoukh Baytaalay ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like ghost, the apostate being nothing goes on expressing his ego.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 bymuKwN nwl AVnw insPl hY

Shabad OS B.translation: It is useless to quarrel with the apostates

lines.gurmukhi: nwir Bqwrhu bwhrI suiK syj nw cVIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Naari Bhataarahu Baaharee Soukhi Sayj N Charheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without husband a woman cannot enjoy pleasures of bed.

lines.gurmukhi: puqu n mMnY mwipAwN kmjwqIN vVIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Poutu N Mannai Maapiaan Kamajaateen Varheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the son disobeys the parents, he is considered a bastard.

lines.gurmukhi: vxjwrw swhhu iPrY vyswhu n jVIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Vanajaaraa Saahahoun Dhirai Vaysaahu N Jarheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a merchant does not keep his word given to his banker, he loses his faith.

lines.gurmukhi: swihbu sauhYN Awpxy hQIAwru n PVIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Saahibu Sauhain Aapanay Hadiaaru N Dharheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Take not arms against your master.

lines.gurmukhi: kUVu n phuMcY sc no sau GwVq GVIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Koorhu N Pahounchai Sach No Sau Ghaarhat Gharheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The falsehood can never reach the truth even if hundred excuses are made.

lines.gurmukhi: muMdRwN kMin ijnwVIAwN iqnHwN nwil n AVIAY ]21]34]
lines.transliteration_english: Moundraan Kanni Jinaarheeaan Tin Naali N Arheeai ?21?34?chaouteeha?

Shabad OS B.translation: One should not behave stubbornly before the people wearing earrings (because they are most obdurate ones).

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satiguroo Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: durmiq myit gurmiq ihrdY pRgwsI Koey hY AigAwn jwny bHm igAwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Duramati Mayti Gurmati Hiradai Pragaasee , Khoay Hai Agiaan Jaanay Braham Giaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: When a disciple meets his Guru and he works hard and toil himself on his precepts, he gets rid of base intellect and divine intelligence is revealed to him. He sheds his ignorance and acquires His knowledge.

lines.gurmukhi: drs iDAwn Awn iDAwn ibsmrn kY sbd suriq moin bRq prvwny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Daras Dhiaan Aan Dhiaan Bisamaran Kai , Sabad Surati Moni Brat Paravaanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By the glimpse of the True Guru and focusing his mind, he weans away his attention from worldly pleasures and concentrates the divine word in his consciousness and closes his mind from all other attractions.

lines.gurmukhi: pRym rs risk hie An rs rhq huie joqI mY joiq srUp sohM sur qwny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Praym Ras Rasik Ha?i An Ras Rahat Hui , Jotee Mai Joti Saroop Sohan Sur Taanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In His love, leaving all worldly pleasures, getting absorbed in His Naam, he keeps on remembering Him all the time.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK sMD imly bIs iekIs eIs pUrn ibbyk tyk eyk hIXy Awny hY ]34]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Sandh Milay Bees Ikees Eesa , Pooran Bibayk Tayk Ayk Heeyay Aanay Hai ?34?

Shabad OS B.translation: Believe it for Sure that by meeting with Guru, a Guru conscious person becomes one with Lord and all his life depends on Naam Simran-an exclusive support of the Lord. (34)
